0.text: There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature.
0.author: Jane Austen

1.text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
1.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

2.text: I am good, but not an angel. I do sin, but I am not the devil. I am just a small girl in a big world trying to find someone to love.
2.author: Marilyn Monroe

3.text: If I were not a physicist, I would probably be a musician. I often think in music. I live my daydreams in music. I see my life in terms of music.
3.author: Albert Einstein

4.text: If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking.
4.author: Haruki Murakami

5.text: The difference between genius and stupidity is: genius has its limits.
5.author: Alexandre Dumas fils

6.text: He's like a drug for you, Bella.
6.author: Stephenie Meyer

7.text: There is no friend as loyal as a book.
7.author: Ernest Hemingway

8.text: When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
8.author: Helen Keller

9.text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
9.author: George Bernard Shaw
